content.question: The graph represents the force exerted by a barrier on a ball as the ball collides with and bounces off the barrier. The initial and final velocities of the ball have the same magnitude <math alttext="v" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>v</mi></math> but opposite directions. Which of the following graphs could represent the force exerted on the ball if the initial and final speeds of the ball were <math alttext="2 v" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mi>v</mi></math> but the contact time remained the same?

choices.label: The figure shows a graph of 4 line segments in a coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled “Time, in 10 to the negative 3 power second,” and the numbers 0 through 6, in increments of 2, are indicated. The vertical axis is labeled “Force, in 10 cubed newtons,” and the numbers 0 through 8, in increments of 1, are indicated. The first line segment begins at the point with coordinates 0 comma 0 and moves horizontally to the right until it ends at 2 seconds. The second line segment begins where the first line segment ends, and moves steeply upward to the right until it ends at the point with coordinates 3 comma 6. The third line segment begins where the second line segment ends, and moves downward and to the right  until it ends on the horizontal axis at 4 seconds. The fourth line segment begins where the third line segment ends, and moves horizontally to the right until it ends at 6 seconds.

The figure shows a graph of 2 line segments in a coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled “Time, in 10 to the negative 3 power second,” and the numbers 0 through 6, in increments of 2, are indicated. The vertical axis is labeled “Force, in 10 cubed newtons,” and the numbers 0 through 8, in increments of 1, are indicated. The first line segment begins at the point with coordinates 0 comma 0 and moves upward to the right until it ends at the point with coordinates 3 comma 6. The second line segment begins where the first line segment ends, and moves downward and to the right  until it ends on the horizontal axis at 6 seconds.

The figure shows a graph of 4 line segments in a coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled “Time, in 10 to the negative 3 power second,” and the numbers 0 through 6, in increments of 2, are indicated. The vertical axis is labeled “Force, in 10 cubed newtons,” and the numbers 0 through 8, in increments of 1, are indicated. The first line segment begins at the point with coordinates 0 comma 0 and moves horizontally to the right until it ends at 2 seconds. The second line segment begins where the first line segment ends, and moves steeply upward to the right until it ends at the point with coordinates 3 comma 1.5. The third line segment begins where the second line segment ends, and moves downward and to the right  until it ends on the horizontal axis at 4 seconds. The fourth line segment begins where the third line segment ends, and moves horizontally to the right until it ends at 6 seconds.

The figure shows a graph of 2 line segments in a coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled “Time, in 10 to the negative 3 power second,” and the numbers 0 through 6, in increments of 2, are indicated. The vertical axis is labeled “Force, in 10 cubed newtons,” and the numbers 0 through 8, in increments of 1, are indicated. The first line segment begins at the point with coordinates 0 comma 0 and moves upward to the right until it ends at the point with coordinates 3 comma 1.5. The second line segment begins where the first line segment ends, and moves downward and to the right  until it ends on the horizontal axis at 6 seconds.

content.answer: The figure shows a graph of 4 line segments in a coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled “Time, in 10 to the negative 3 power second,” and the numbers 0 through 6, in increments of 2, are indicated. The vertical axis is labeled “Force, in 10 cubed newtons,” and the numbers 0 through 8, in increments of 1, are indicated. The first line segment begins at the point with coordinates 0 comma 0 and moves horizontally to the right until it ends at 2 seconds. The second line segment begins where the first line segment ends, and moves steeply upward to the right until it ends at the point with coordinates 3 comma 6. The third line segment begins where the second line segment ends, and moves downward and to the right  until it ends on the horizontal axis at 4 seconds. The fourth line segment begins where the third line segment ends, and moves horizontally to the right until it ends at 6 seconds.

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
